thread.title: Let’s Split The Last One (Crossword Contest, April 27)

author: blogs.wsj.com
title: Let’s Split The Last One (Crossword Contest, April 27)
text:
31 COMMENTS Download PDF
Please don’t post any spoilers until after the contest deadline.
PLAY PRINT SHOW COMMENTS HIDE COMMENTS (31) Failed to load comments 31 comments Get Livefyre FAQ Sign in + Follow Post comment Link Newest | Oldest Peter Abide user 5pts
Much easier than recent weeks. It fell for me with less than half the grid finished.
DAVID LIPPMAN user 5pts
Oh my gosh! I think I've got it! After refusing to leave a very convincing rabbit hole, I suddenly came up with the answer out of the blue. Thank you, "post-enlightenment!"
I enjoyed some of the fun clues, such as 5A and 62A. (Tina)
DAVID LIPPMAN user 5pts
Hmm...at a loss for now. At least, I hope it's just for now. (Tina)
Bill Katz user 5pts
I've got the grid - but I'm still at sea. I don't yet see a mechanism... Perhaps tomorrow.
Fred Stadler subscriber 5pts
I groaned when I saw that the answer was a sitcom (one of my various knowledge voids). But I grudgingly accepted that it must be fairly well known, since I did recognize it, likely without ever having watched.
Tom Shea subscriber 5pts
Robert,
Please mark me down for three previous weeks with Isaac. I apologize for not owning up, but my excuse (and I'm sticking to it) is I barely attempted, meant to, but never posted because... I am now officially retired.
I have the grid for this week, but no clue on first pass for the meta. Will attempt to solve whenever I can wipe the wide grin off my face.
Count me hanging with Isaac for the foreseeable future. Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ Tom Shea I have you on the ship but I don't keep track of maximum numbers on the ship.
I am with Isaac and a lot of others. Not watching sitcoms, I may have heard of this but probably have not ever seen it. Barbara Koehler subscriber 5pts
@ Tom Shea Congratulations on your retirement! Hope you'll still have time to do puzzles, now that your days are filled with other fun stuff.
Tom Shea subscriber 5pts
@ Barbara Koehler @ Tom Shea
Barbara,
Thank you.
I concur with your previous post that I wish the avatars were back (uniformly)
I will be of course doing puzzles, probably more so, now that I have more time. (Wish Mr. Berry did a rows garden every day.)
Still, I am frustrated I am 0 for April so far here.
JOHN WEBBER subscriber 5pts
More pop culture nonsense. Shame on Gaffney.
CRAIG BIRKER subscriber 5pts
So many rabbits. A virtual warren. (Heidi)
Kas DeCarvalho user 5pts
When I tried to submit on my Approid, it wouldn't let me. The message was, "Oh, just stop, you noob--you know that answer is utter @#%%...don't embarrass us."
It didn't, really...but that's why I'm strictly a pen-and-paper guy...
John Cole subscriber 5pts
Beth and I would be on shore, but the submission isn't working. We chased a couple of rabbits until we got it. I've never seen it, but got the answer. Just submitted via e-mail.
FRIDA CHEN user 5pts
Oooh, TV! One of my favorite topics :D :D :D
And just to make it more fun sprinkle in some sports, singers, and obscure (to me) clothiers
And that's only in the major parts of the puzzle....So many more of these sprinkled throughout.
Can you tell how much I'm loving this one?
I just finished the grid and see the obvious but don't know how to use it yet...unless it involves Investigation by Google. Leaving it for now. Maybe I'll decide to go further with it....especially if any of the muggles who know me tell me that they think I should.
Kas DeCarvalho user 5pts
@ FRIDA CHEN Resist! Resist the evil Google siren!!! :)
Barbara Koehler subscriber 5pts
@ FRIDA CHEN You'll have to google sitcoms. You can get it, but I don't know that you'll enjoy it.
A L SCHWARTZ subscriber 5pts
Done and done. Not sure I've ever watched, but certainly well known.
The submit function didn't work on my android this week, though. Ended up submitting by email.
ALS
Barbara Koehler subscriber 5pts
Hmm. My knowledge of sitcoms is pretty limited. Google, here I come.
I've got an answer that I'm pretty sure is right, but it doesn't feel completely satisfying. Not sure if that's because it just seems too easy or because I don't know enough about the show, or some other show, to recognize more complexities. Times like this, I'd really like an MGWCC-style difficulty rating. If this were a week 1 or 2 puzzle, I'd be confident I got it. If it were 3 or later, I'd keep looking.
JOSEPH MICHAEL subscriber 5pts
Hmm...got the grid (tricky here and there though!), and I have a sense of where the meta is going
not ashore yet though, perhaps on a rowboat heading there, we'll see...
Eric Conrad user 5pts
On shore!
Anita H user 5pts
Nice one! Count me on shore, Blue Hawaiian in hand.
Edward Humphrey subscriber 5pts
Twice got a response that said:
Your submission is not working at this time
Please try again later.
I guess I'll imbibe something cold in the meantime; there's an IPA chilling with my name on it.
Ed
Barbara Koehler subscriber 5pts
@ MIKE MILLER Is someone working on the problem of our profile pictures not showing up on the blogs - especially if we change them? I miss seeing them.
MIKE MILLER staff 5pts
@ Edward Humphrey Sorry you're having trouble. You can always just email crosswordcontest @wsj.com with the answer in the subject line.
MIKE MILLER staff 5pts
@Edward Humphrey Also, if you're able to drop a note to puzzles @wsj.com explaining the problem you encountered, that would help us address it. Thanks again.
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ Barbara Koehler @ MIKE MILLER I have given up trying to put ups a profile picture. There is one there but it does not show up
Edward Humphrey subscriber 5pts
Done and Done.
Ashore.
It was relatively easy.
Ed
(but not allowing me to submit the answer?)
Janet Ross user 5pts
I just started the grid. I hope I'll get the meta, since I don't usually watch sitcoms.
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ Janet Ross I am with you. The number of sitcoms I have watched in the past 40 years is almost none - much to the annoyance of our daughter.
Al Sisti user 5pts
Safely in the sand... nice meta.
Robert Stevens subscriber 5pts
@ Al Sisti Well done.
